abstract: The British oil company faces up to $18 billion in civil penalties, but appeals and a growing cash flow could limit the damage to its bottom line.
snippet: The British oil company faces up to $18 billion in civil penalties, but appeals and a growing cash flow could limit the damage to its bottom line.
lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — BP fought long and hard to avoid the defeat it suffered in court on Thursday when a federal judge ruled that the oil company was chiefly responsible for the Deepwater Horizon oil rig explosion, opening the door to new civil penalties that could potentially amount to $18 billion.

headline.main: Oil Spill Penalty Will Hurt, but Not Cripple, BP
headline.print_headline: Oil Spill Penalty Will Hurt, but Not Cripple, BP
